chapter.title: Getting Started
chapter.para: So you decided to use axon for your project. Best way to get an idea about the framework is to have a look at the sample (TODO link). The sample gives a good idea about the structure of a typical project using axon. The sample shows a web project that includes the axon framework as libraries.

When starting with axon for your own project, the easiest way is to use maven as a build tool. If you feel like creating your own war, you can download the full distribution (TODO decide if we want to do this). Be sure to check the optional libraries as well. These are not provided by default.

sect1.title: Checkout the sample(s)
sect1.para: The samples give you a jump start for you own project. At the moment we have an address book sample available. There are two different clients in that sample, a flex client and a console client. The sample demonstrates the different datasources and heavily relies on the event mechanism of axon. sect1.title: Create your own project
sect1.para: Time to get your feet wet and create your own project. Including axon is straigtforward when using maven. This section explains the maven way and gives some pointers for those that do not want to use maven.

sect2.title: Using maven
sect2.para: If you use maven as your build tool, you need to configure the correct dependencies for your project. Since axon is not yet in one of the major maven repositories, you have to configure a repository for the axon artifacts in your pom.

sect3.title: Additional dependencies
sect3.para: Most of the features provided by the Axon Framework are optional and require additional dependencies. We have chosen not to add these dependencies by default, as they would potentioly clutter your project with artifacts you don't need. This section discusses these dependecies and describes in what scenarios you need them.

simplesect.title: Event Sourcing
simplesect.para: The event sourcing repository that is provided in Axon (XStreamFileSystemEventStore) requires XStream. You need to add the following maven dependency to your project to use this repository implementation.

simplesect.title: Spring Integration
simplesect.para: The Axon Framework provides connectors that allow you to publish events on a Spring Integration channel. These connectors require Spring Integration on the classpath. You need the following maven dependency to use these connectors.

sect2.title: Without maven
sect2.para: If you feel the need to use something different than maven to build your project, you can use the distribution including dependencies. At the moment we do not really support this way to create your project. It should be pretty straightforward to copy the required libraries as well as the necessary optional libraries to your project.
